intro: Senecio schischkinii, commonly known as Schischkin's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
